Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner has basic idea of using writing material.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी के पास लेखन सामग्री का उपयोग करने का बुनियादी विचार है।

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is able to use various writing materials like: pencils, coloured pencils, crayons. Has basic knowledge of strokes but requires extensive practice for the same.
Proficiency_Levels.Description_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी विभिन्न लेखन उपकरणों का उपयोग करने में सक्षम है जैसे; पेंसिल, रंगीन पेंसिल, रंगीन मोम की खड़ियाँ। कलम चलाने का बुनियादी ज्ञान है लेकिन इसके लिए व्यापक अभ्यास की आवश्यकता है।

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is able to use various writing materials like: pencils, coloured pencils, crayons. Has basic knowledge of strokes, requires some practice.
Proficiency_Levels.Description_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी विभिन्न लेखन उपकरणों का उपयोग करने में सक्षम जैसे; पेंसिल, रंगीन पेंसिल, रंगीन मोम की खड़ियाँ। कलम चलाने का बुनियादी ज्ञान है, कुछ अभ्यास की आवश्यकता है।

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is able to use various writing materials like: pencils, coloured pencils, crayons. With basic knowledge of strokes, draws recognizable shapes.
Proficiency_Levels.Description_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी विभिन्न लेखन उपकरणों का उपयोग करने में सक्षम जैसे; पेंसिल, रंगीन पेंसिल, रंगीन मोम की खड़ियाँ। कलम चलाने का बुनियादी ज्ञान हैं, पहचानने योग्य आकृतियाँ बनाता है।

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is able to use various writing materials like: pencils, coloured pencils, crayons. Has basic knowledge of strokes. Draws, colours and orally expresses the intent of the drawing.
Proficiency_Levels.Description_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी विभिन्न लेखन उपकरणों का उपयोग करने में सक्षम जैसे; पेंसिल, रंगीन पेंसिल, रंगीन मोम की खड़ियाँ। कलम चलाने का बुनियादी ज्ञान है। चित्र बनाने, रंग भरने तथा चित्र बनाने के आशय को मौखिक रूप से बताता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner scribbles/draws and paints for self-expression.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी आत्म-अभिव्यक्ति के लिए स्क्रिबल्स / चित्र बनाता है और रंग भरता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner begins to form recognizable letters.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी पहचानने योग्य अक्षर बनाना शुरू करता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses a pencil and holds it properly to form recognizable letters.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी पहचानने योग्य अक्षर बनाने के लिए पेंसिल का उपयोग करता है और उसे ठीक से पकड़ता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognizes and writes his/her own name.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी अपना नाम पहचानता है और लिखता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner scribbles/draws and paints for self-expression.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी आत्म-अभिव्यक्ति के लिए स्क्रिबल्स /चित्र बनाता है और रंग भरता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner begins to form recognizable letters.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी पहचानने योग्य अक्षर बनाना शुरू करता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses a pencil and holds it properly to form recognizable letters.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी पहचानने योग्य अक्षर बनाने के लिए पेंसिल का उपयोग करता है और उसे ठीक से पकड़ता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognizes and writes his/her own name.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी अपना नाम पहचानता है और लिखता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner develops familiarity with matras in words occurring in familiar context (Story/Poems/environment/Print etc.)
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी परिचित संदर्भों (कहानी/ कविता/परिवेश के मुद्रित सामग्री इत्यादि) में आए शब्दों की मात्राओं से परिचय विकसित करता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner writes, draws and/ or makes things to convey meaning and represent names on her/his worksheet, greeting messages, draws pictures that are recognizable objects/people.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी अर्थ बताने के लिए लिखता है, चित्र बनाता है या चीजें बनाता है और अपने कार्यपत्रक पर नामों को प्रदर्शित करता है, शुभकामना संदेश देता है, वस्तुओं/व्यक्तियों के ऐसे चित्र बनाता है जो पहचाने जा सके।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses sound symbol correspondence to write words with invented spellings.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी शब्दों को लिखने के लिए स्वरों और अक्षरों से परिचित हो जाते हैं और स्वयं वर्तनी लिखना शुरू कर देते हैं।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner writes 2-3 sentences with understanding.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी स्वयं समझकर 2-3 वाक्य लिखता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner develops familiarity with matras in words occurring in familiar context (Story/Poems/ environment/Print etc.)
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी परिचित संदर्भों (कहानी/ कविता/परिवेश के मुद्रित सामग्री इत्यादि) में आए शब्दों की मात्राओं से परिचय विकसित करता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner writes, draws and/or makes things to convey meaning and represent names on her/his worksheet, greeting messages, draws pictures that are recognizable objects/people.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी अर्थ बताने के लिए लिखता है, चित्र बनाता है या चीजें बनाता है और अपने कार्यपत्रक पर नामों को प्रदर्शित करता है, शुभकामना संदेश देता है, वस्तुओं/व्यक्तियों के ऐसे चित्र बनाता है जो पहचाने जा सके।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses sound symbol correspondence to write words with invented spellings.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी शब्दों को लिखने के लिए स्वरों और अक्षरों से परिचित हो जाते हैं और स्वयं वर्तनी लिखना शुरू कर देते हैं।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner writes 2-3 sentences with understanding.
Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी स्वयं समझकर 2-3 वाक्य लिखता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner writes short/ simple sentences to express their understanding and expressions.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी अपनी समझ और अभिव्यक्ति को व्यक्त करने के लिए छोटे / सरल वाक्यों को सही ढंग से लिखता है।

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner writes 4 to 5 short sentences with legible writing.
Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_Hindi: शिक्षार्थी सुपाठ्य लेखन के साथ 4-5 छोटे वाक्य लिखता है।

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner develops letters recognition, sound symbol correspondence.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner begins to identify the sound and symbol relationship with the help and support of teacher.
The learner begins to recognize visually and connects letters to corresponding sounds, sometimes requires help and support.
The learner displays letters recognition, sound symbol correspondence with accuracy and clarity.
The learner mimics and reproduces sounds independently with clarity and accuracy. Helps peers as well.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner displays emergent literacy skills.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner understands the basic structure of book with some help and support.
The learner understands the basic structure of book. Handles the books with care.
The learner understands the basic structure of book. Recognizes/identifies common signs, logos, and labels. Has idea of words in print and direction in which they are printed.

The learner understands the basic structure of book. Recognizes/ identifies common signs, logos, and labels. Has idea of words in print and direction in which they are printed and read. Helps others also.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner looks at books and attempts reading the story with the help of pictures.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner talks about and attempts to read picture books, identifies objects and actions with extensive support.
The learner talks about and reads the print available in the surroundings with some help. Reads picture books and identifies objects and actions.
The learner talks about print available in the surroundings independently in two to three sentences. Reads and describes picture story in simple sentences.

The learner talks about print available in the surroundings confidently using more than three sentences in age-appropriate vocabulary. Reads and describes picture story in simple sentences in proper flow.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner begins to point out and recognise some familiar repeated/rhyming words. (Sight words or words on containers/food wrappers)

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recognises some of the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/ some of food wrappers) with little assistance.
The learner recognises most of the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/ food wrappers).
The learner recognises the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/food wrappers) confidently and correctly.
The learner recognises the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/food wrappers) accurately and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds with extensive help from the teacher.
The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds correctly most of the times, needs little support.
The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds correctly and accurately.
The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds independently with accuracy and helps others also.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner reads simple words comprising of at least 2-3 letters of the alphabets.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner attempts to read simple words of 2 to 3 letters of the alphabets with extensive help of the teacher.
The learner reads simple words of 2-3 letters of the alphabets correctly/accurately with little help by the teacher.
The learner reads words of 2-3 letters of the alphabets correctly with proper pronunciation independently.
The learner reads words of 2-3 or more letters of the alphabets confidently with proper pronunciation and helps others too.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner looks at books and attempts reading the story with the help of pictures.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner talks about and attempts to read picture books, identifies objects and actions with extensive support.
The learner talks about and reads the print available in the surroundings with some help. Reads picture books and identifies objects and actions.
The learner talks about print available in the surroundings independently in two to three sentences. Reads and describes picture story in simple sentences.

The learner talks about print available in the surroundings confidently using more than three sentences in age-appropriate vocabulary. Reads and describes picture story in simple sentences in proper flow.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner begins to point out and recognise some familiar repeated/rhyming words. (Sight words or words on containers/food wrappers)

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recognises some of the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/ some of food wrappers) with little assistance.
The learner recognises most of the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/ food wrappers).
The learner recognises the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/food wrappers) confidently and correctly.
The learner recognises the familiar repeated/rhyming words (sight words or words on containers/food wrappers) accurately and helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds with extensive help from the teacher.
The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds correctly most of the times, needs little support.
The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds correctly and accurately.
The learner recognises letters and corresponding sounds independently with accuracy and helps others also.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner reads simple words comprising at least 2-3 letters of the alphabets.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner attempts to read simple words of 2 to 3 letters of the alphabets with extensive help of the teacher.
The learner reads simple words of 2-3 letters of the alphabets correctly/accurately with little help by the teacher.
The learner reads words of 2-3 letters of the alphabets correctly with proper pronunciation independently.
The learner reads words of 2-3 or more letters of the alphabets confidently with proper pronunciation and helps others too.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner participates during read aloud/ story telling sessions in an active way and answers questions during and after story sessions; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner participates during read aloud/ story telling sessions. Responds to questions that require one/ two words answers during and after story sessions; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets with extensive support.

The learner participates during read aloud/ story telling sessions and responds to fact based questions during and after story sessions with a little prompt and support; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets with encouragement and guidance.

The learner participates actively during read aloud/ story telling sessions and independently responds to fact-based questions during and after story sessions; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets.

The learner participates actively and meaningfully during read aloud/ story telling sessions and independently responds to fact and inference-based questions during and after story sessions; acts out familiar and unfamiliar stories with props and puppets. Extends ideas from the story in novel ways.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses sound-symbol correspondence to read new words.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner attempts to read new words using letters and their associated sound correspondence. With support of the teacher uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods.
The learner reads new words using letters and their associated sounds. Uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods. Sometimes requires support.
The learner reads new words using letters and their associated sounds correctly and independently. Uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods to read with clarity and fluency.

The learner reads new words using letters and their associated sounds correctly and independently. Actively uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods to read with clarity, fluency and accuracy.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner reads small sentences consisting of at least 4-5 simple words in an age-appropriate unknown text.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner attempts to read an age appropriate unknown text word by word with extensive assistance by the teacher.
The learner reads sentences from an age appropriate unknown text (of 4-5 simple words) with little help by the teacher.
The learner reads sentences from an age appropriate unknown text (of 4-5 simple words) independently and correctly.
The learner reads sentences from an age appropriate unknown text (of more than 5 simple words) fluently with confidence and accuracy.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner participates during read aloud/ story telling sessions in an active way and answers questions during and after story sessions; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner participates during read aloud/ story telling sessions. Responds to questions that require one/two words answers during and after story sessions; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets with extensive support.

The learner participates during read aloud/ story telling sessions and responds to fact based questions during and after story sessions with a little prompt and support; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets with encouragement and guidance.

The learner participates actively during read aloud/ story telling sessions and independently responds to fact-based questions during and after story sessions; acts out familiar stories with props and puppets.

The learner participates actively and meaningfully during read aloud/ story telling sessions and independently responds to fact and inference-based questions during and after story sessions; acts out familiar and unfamiliar stories with props and puppets. Extends ideas from the story in novel ways.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses sound-symbol correspondence to read new words.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner attempts to read new words using letters and their associated sound correspondence. With support of the teacher uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods.
The learner reads new words using letters and their associated sounds. Uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods. Sometimes requires support.
The learner reads new words using letters and their associated sounds correctly and independently. Uses phoneme blending/addition and substitution methods to read with clarity and fluency.

The learner reads new words using letters and their associated sounds correctly and independently. Actively uses phoneme blending/ addition and substitution methods to read with clarity, fluency and accuracy.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner reads small sentences consisting of at least 4-5 simple words in an age-appropriate unknown text.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner attempts to read an age appropriate unknown text word by word with extensive assistance by the teacher.
The learner reads sentences from an age appropriate unknown text (of 4-5 simple words) with little help by the teacher.
The learner reads sentences from an age appropriate unknown text (of 4-5 simple words) independently and correctly.
The learner reads sentences from an age appropriate unknown text (of more than 5 simple words) fluently with confidence and accuracy.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner reads and narrates /retells the stories from children's literature/ textbook.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner reads and comprehends the story when guided by the teacher and retells/ narrates with the support of pictures and cues.
The learner reads and comprehends the story with the help of the teacher and retells/ narrates it with limited words from the text and incomplete sentences.
The learner reads and comprehends the story and sequences the events to retells/ narrate the same using appropriate words from the text with voice modulation, clarity, and correctness.
The learner reads and comprehends the story and sequences the events to retells/ narrate the same in his own words with voice modulation, clarity, actions and gestures.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner creates meaningful new words from the letters of a given word.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner creates 2-3 known words from the given word with prompts from the teacher.
The learner creates 3 - 4 known words from the given word.
The learner creates 4-5 known words from the given word.
The learner creates more than 5 possible words independently from the given word. Sometimes makes words not introduced in the classroom context as well.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner reads age appropriate unknown text of 6 to 8 sentences with simple words with comprehension, clarity and fluency.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner reads age appropriate unknown text of 6 to 8 sentences with simple words with the help of the teacher. Finds it difficult to relate letters and sounds. Has limited knowledge of sight words.
The learner reads age appropriate unknown text of 6 to 8 sentences with simple words slowly with the help of the teacher using limited knowledge of phonics, sight words and syllable.

The learner reads age appropriate unknown text of 6 to 8 sentences with simple words with appropriate speed, pauses, clarity and pronunciation. Has fair knowledge of phonics, sight words and syllables.

The learner reads age appropriate unknown text of 6 to 8 sentences with simple words fluently and independently unknown text of more than 10 sentences with simple words with appropriate speed, pauses, clarity and pronunciation. Has very good knowledge of phonics, sight words and syllables.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner listens attentively and follows instructions.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner hesitates and pauses along while following the instructions. Lacks accuracy and clarity.
The learner follows simple instructions comprising of 2 to 3 steps at a time with some help, prompts and support.
The learner follows simple instructions comprising of 2 to 3 steps at a time without help and support.
The learner follows simple instructions comprising of 2 to 3 steps at a time independently and correctly, also helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recites songs and rhymes.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recites a familiar age-appropriate song or a rhyme with difficulty in rhyme and rhythm. Lacks comprehension and expression.
The learner recites a simple song or a rhyme with the help of teacher. Lacks expression and body language.
The learner recites a simple song or a rhyme with proper rhyme and rhythm. Uses stress, intonation, gestures and actions.
The learner recites a simple song or a rhyme without errors in proper rhyme, rhythm and gestures. Helps others also with the same.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner talks to friends and teachers.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner hesitates to initiate speech, avoids conversation, lacks clarity.
The learner initiates speech/talk with friends and teachers with some support.
The learner talks/converses with friends and teachers independently with clarity using small sentences.
The learner talks/converses with friends and teachers with confidence and clarity, assists others too.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recites rhymes/poems with understanding.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recites familiar rhymes/poems with difficulty in rhyme and rhythm. Lacks comprehension and expression.
The learner recites familiar rhymes / poems with little help from teacher. Tries to follow the rhyme, rhythm and gestures.
The learner recites familiar rhymes / poems without any help. Expressions, gestures and rhythm are used appropriately and confidently.
The learner recites age-appropriate unfamiliar rhymes / poems without errors with proper expressions, gestures and rhythm. Helps others with the same.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner talks to friends and teachers.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner hesitates to initiate speech, avoids conversation, lacks clarity.
The learner initiates speech/talk with friends and teachers with some support.
The learner talks/converses with friends and teachers independently with clarity using small sentences.
The learner talks/converses with friends and teachers with confidence and clarity, assists others too.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recites rhymes/poems with understanding.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recites familiar rhymes / poems with difficulty in rhyme and rhythm. Lacks comprehension and expression.
The learner recites familiar rhymes / poems with little help from teacher. Tries to follow the rhyme, rhythm and gestures.
The learner recites familiar rhymes / poems without any help. Expressions, gestures and rhythm are used appropriately and confidently.
The learner recites age-appropriate unfamiliar rhymes / poems without errors with proper expressions, gestures and rhythm. Helps others with the same.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner converses and ask questions with friends and class teacher about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner hesitates / avoids conversations. Needs support to use appropriate body language, vocabulary and sentence structure.

The learner converses and ask questions about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings with some support. Uses few short sentences, needs support to use appropriate vocabulary, fluency and body language.
The learner converses and ask questions about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings independently using short sentences with appropriate vocabulary, fluency and body language.

The learner converses and ask questions about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings confidently and independently using sentences with appropriate vocabulary, fluency and body language leading to engaging conversations.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner talks about the print available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner talks about the printed material available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings with support. Gropes for vocabulary, hesitates and pauses, that can lead to lack of clarity in expression.
The learner attempts to use age-appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure about the print material.
The learner talks about the print available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings. using two to three simple sentences with proper vocabulary and sentence structure.

The learner talks about the print available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings. independently and confidently using more than three simple sentences with age-appropriate vocabulary, body language and sentence structure in a proper flow.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recites rhymes/ poems/songs with action.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recites poems/ songs with hesitation and faces difficulties with rhyme and rhythm lacks comprehension and expression. Needs extensive support for recitation of poem.
The learner recites familiar poems/ songs with rhyme and rhythm with some comprehension and expression with the help of the teacher.
The learner recites independently with comprehension and age-appropriate poems/ songs with rhyme and rhythm with appropriate body language and expressions, gestures and actions.

The learner recites age appropriate unfamiliar poems/songs with rhyme and rhythm. Uses intonation and voice modulation to bring in expressiveness independently with comprehension and appropriate body language of expression, gestures and actions.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner converses and ask questions with friends and class teacher about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner hesitates / avoids conversations. Needs support to use appropriate body language, vocabulary and sentence structure.

The learner converses and ask questions about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings with some support. Uses few short sentences, needs support to use appropriate vocabulary, fluency and body language.
The learner converses and ask questions about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings independently using short sentences with appropriate vocabulary, fluency and body language.

The learner converses and ask questions about his/her needs, familiar persons and surroundings confidently and independently using sentences with appropriate vocabulary, fluency and body language leading to engaging conversations.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner talks about the print available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner talks about the printed material available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings with support. Gropes for vocabulary, hesitates and pauses, that can lead to lack of clarity in expression.
The learner attempts to use age-appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure about the print material.
The learner talks about the print available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings. using two to three simple sentences with proper vocabulary and sentence structure.

The learner talks about the print available in the classroom, school premises and surroundings. independently and confidently using more than three simple sentences with age-appropriate vocabulary, body language and sentence structure in a proper flow.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recites rhymes/songs/ poems with action.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recites poems/ songs with hesitation and faces difficulties with rhyme and rhythm lacks comprehension and expression. Needs extensive support for recitation of poem.
The learner recites familiar poems/ songs with rhyme and rhythm with some comprehension and expression with the help of the teacher.
The learner recites independently with comprehension and age-appropriate poems/ songs with rhyme and rhythm with appropriate body language and expressions, gestures and actions.

The learner recites age-appropriate familiar and unfamiliar poems/songs with rhyme and rhythm and without errors. Uses stress, intonation, and voice modulation to bring in expressiveness. Independently recites with comprehension and appropriate body language of expressions, gestures and actions.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner converses and talks about the print available in the classroom.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner converses and talks about print in the classroom with extensive support. Uses less than two sentences, gropes for vocabulary, hesitates and pauses along with inappropriate body language that leads to lack of clarity in expression.
The learner converses and talks about the print in the classroom without clarity. Uses less than 6 short sentences and needs some support to use appropriate vocabulary, fluency, and body language.
The learner talks about the print available in the classroom using six- eight simple sentences with appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.

The learner talks about the print available in the classroom independently and confidently using more than eight simple sentences with age appropriate vocabulary, body language and sentence structures in a proper flow.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner engages in conversation to ask questions and listens to others.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner engages in conversations hesitantly. Finds it difficult to frame questions. Tries to answer the questions in one or two words. Avoids taking the conversation forward. Has limited vocabulary and less clarity and accuracy.

The learner engages in conversation with the help of the teacher. Needs prompts to ask questions and take the conversation forward. Answers questions in simple sentences. Takes help of the teacher for vocabulary and accuracy.

The learner engages in conversations, frames correct and meaningful questions, listens to others and gives relevant answers to the questions. Takes the conversation forward by building upon it with the help of appropriate vocabulary, with accuracy.

The learner initiates and engages in conversations and creates suitable environment for meaningful discussion. Listens to others attentively and adds inputs accordingly. Speaks spontaneously and responds correctly with the help of appropriate vocabulary with accuracy.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recites songs/poems.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recites familiar poems/ songs with hesitation. Faces difficulty with rhyme and rhythm. For recitation of the poem/ song with comprehension and appropriate body language of expressions, gestures and actions, needs extensive support.

The learner recites familiar poems/songs with rhyme and rhythm with the help of the teacher. Tries to use stress, intonation, and voice modulation. Recites the poem/ song with comprehension and appropriate body language of expressions, gestures and actions with some support.

The learner recites familiar poems/ songs with rhyme and rhythm. Uses stress, intonation, and voice modulation. Recites with comprehension and appropriate body language of expressions, gestures and actions in group.

The learner recites age-appropriate familiar and unfamiliar poems/songs with rhyme and rhythm and without errors. Uses stress, intonation, and voice modulation to bring in expressiveness. Independently recites with comprehension and appropriate body language of expressions, gestures and actions.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner repeats familiar words occurring in stories/poems/print etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recalls and uses the words encountered in familiar and unfamiliar stories/poems/ print in conversations, talks, sharing and other interactions with extensive support.
The learner recalls and uses the words encountered in familiar and unfamiliar stories/poems/ print in conversations, talks, sharing and other interactions with little support or cues.
The learner recalls and uses the words encountered in familiar and unfamiliar stories/poems/ print in conversations, talks, sharing and other interactions independently.

The learner recalls and creatively uses the words encountered in familiar and unfamiliar stories/ poems/print in conversations, talks, sharing and other interactions. Orally frames meaningful and novel sentences with these words and uses them in new ways in different contexts.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner counts to tell number of objects less than 5.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner needs teacher's prompts/assistance to count the objects.
The learner counts objects up to 5 with the help of teacher.
The learner counts to tell number of objects up to 5, with few mistakes.
The learner counts and tells number of objects up to 5 independently and correctly.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognises and names 1 to 5 objects/dots/pictures.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner counts objects up to 5 but has difficulty naming them.
The learner recognises and names 5 objects only with the help of the teacher.
The learner recognises and names objects up to 5 with few mistakes.
The learner recognises and names objects up to 5 independently and correctly.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner compares two groups in terms of quantities upto 5 and uses words - More than/Less than.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner compares quantities 1 to 5 with prompt and support, but with difficulty.
The learner compares 2 groups in terms of quantities up to 5, with assistance.
The learner compares 2 groups in terms of quantities up to 5.
The learner compares 2 groups in terms of quantities upto 5 correctly and uses words more than/less than.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner arranges numbers/objects/shapes in a sequence.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner arranges shapes/objects in a sequence but has difficulty in arranging numbers in a sequence.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers in a sequence with the help of the teacher.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers in a sequence with few mistakes.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers in a sequence independently and correctly.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristics.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner classifies objects based on their shape.
The learner classifies the objects based on their shape and size.
The learner classifies objects based on their shape, size and colour.
The learner classifies objects based on observable characteristics such as shape, size, colour, appearance, design, texture etc.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like long, short, tall, heavy, light in the context of different objects around him/her.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like long, short, tall, heavy, light in the context of different objects around him/her with teacher's prompts/assistance.
The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like long, short, tall, heavy, light in the context of different objects around him/her with the little help of the teacher.
The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like long, short, tall, heavy, light in the context of different objects around him/her with few mistakes.
The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like long, short, tall, heavy, light in the context of different objects around him/her independently and correctly.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner counts objects and correlates numbers up to 9.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner counts objects but unable to match the respective numbers correctly.
The learner counts objects up to 9 but matches the respective numbers with the help of teacher.
The learner counts objects and correlates numbers up to 9.
The learner counts independently and matches numbers from a random pile of numbers up to 9 correctly

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 with extensive help of teacher.
The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 with the help of the teacher.
The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 correctly.
The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 correctly, independently and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies and copies/draws simple patterns.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is unable to identify and copy/draw simple patterns without the help of the teacher.
The learner identify and copy/draw simple patterns with prompting and support.
The learner identify and copy/draw simple patterns committing few mistakes.
The learner identify and copy/draw simple patterns independently and correctly.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner compares two groups in terms of number of objects and uses words like - more than/ less than/ equal to etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is unable to identify if a group is greater than/less than or equal to the other group (group size 10), without the help of the teacher.
The learner compares the number of objects in two groups and uses words like more than/less than/equal to, with other group (group size 10), with prompting and support.
The learner compares confidently, the number of objects in a group using words- more than/less than/equal to, with another group, committing few mistakes (group size 10).

The learner identifies and compares the number of objects in a group using words-greater than/less than/ equal to, with the number of objects in another group independently and correctly (group size more than 10).

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner arranges numbers/objects/shapes/occurrence of events in a sequence.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence with the help of the teacher.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence with few prompts.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence with few mistakes independently.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence correctly and independently.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristics and communicates the criteria of classification.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic but has difficulty in communicating the criteria of classification.
The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic and communicates the criteria of classification with the help of teacher.
The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic and communicates the criteria of classification with few mistakes.
The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic and communicates the criteria of classification independently and correctly.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of different objects around him/her.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of familiar objects around him/her with assistance.

The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of any objects around him/her with the little help of teacher in classroom situation.

The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of any objects around him/her in daily life with few mistakes.

The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of objects around him/her independently and correctly and explains the criteria of classification.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner counts objects and correlates numbers up to 9.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner counts objects but unable to match the respective numbers correctly.
The learner counts objects up to 9 but matches the respective numbers with the help of teacher.
The learner counts objects and correlates numbers up to 9.
The learner counts independently and matches numbers from a random pile of numbers up to 9 correctly

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 with extensive help of teacher.
The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 with the help of the teacher.
The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 correctly.
The learner recognises, reads and writes numerals up to 9 correctly, independently and helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies and copies/draws simple patterns.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is unable to identify and copy/draw simple patterns without the help of the teacher.
The learner identify and copy/draw simple patterns with prompting and support.
The learner identify and copy/draw simple patterns committing few mistakes.
The learner identify and copy/draw simple patterns independently and correctly.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner compares two groups in terms of number of objects and uses words like- more than/ less than/ equal to etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is unable to identify if a group is greater than/less than or equal to the other group (group size 10), without the help of the teacher.
The learner compares the number of objects in two groups and uses words like more than/less than/equal to, with other group (group size 10), with prompting and support.
The learner compares confidently, the number of objects in a group using words- more than/less than/equal to, with another group, committing few mistakes (group size 10).

The learner identifies and compares the number of objects in a group using words-greater than/less than/ equal to, with the number of objects in another group independently and correctly (group size more than 10).

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner arranges numbers/objects/shapes/occurrence of events in a sequence.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence with the help of the teacher.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence with few prompts.
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence with few mistakes independently..
The learner arranges shapes/objects/numbers/occurrence of events in a sequence correctly and independently.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristics and communicates the criteria of classification.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic but has difficulty in communicating the criteria of classification.
The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic and communicates the criteria of classification with the help of teacher.
The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic and communicates the criteria of classification with few mistakes.
The learner classifies objects based on their observable characteristic and communicates the criteria of classification independently and correctly.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of different objects around him/her.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of familiar objects around him/her with assistance.

The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of any objects around him/her with the little help of teacher in classroom situation.

The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of any objects around him/her in daily life with few mistakes.

The learner uses vocabulary for comparative words like longer, longest, taller, tallest, shorter, shortest, and heavier than, lighter than etc. in the context of objects around him/her independently and correctly and explains the criteria of classification.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20 with the help of the teacher.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20.
The learner counts objects, develops number sense upto 20 correctly.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20 correctly, independently and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers with extensive support.
The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers without support.
The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers independently.
The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers independently and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) in daily life situations.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner is able to do addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) without/with regrouping and with support.
The learner is able to do addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) without/with regrouping without support,
The learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) in daily life situations correctly.
The learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) in daily life situations independently with accuracy and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner observes and describes physical properties of 3D shapes (solid shapes) around him/her like round/flat surfaces, number of corners and edges etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner observes and classifies 3-D shapes on the basis of physical properties around his/her environment with prompts and support.
The learner observes and classifies 3-D shapes on the basis of physical properties in his environment with little support.
The learner observes, classifies and describes physical properties of 3-D shapes in his/her environment correctly.
The learner observes, classifies and describes physical properties of 3-D shapes in his/her environment independently and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner estimates and verifies length using non- standard non- uniform units like hand span, footstep, fingers etc. and capacity using non- standard uniform units like cup, spoon, mug etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner compares and measures length/ capacity using non-standard non-uniform units with the help of teachers.
The learner compares and measures length/capacity using non-standard non-uniform units without the help of teachers.
The learner estimates and verifies length/ capacity using non-standard non-uniform units with the help of teachers.
The learner estimates and verifies length / capacity using non-standard non-uniform units without the help of teacher and helps others too.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 with the extensive help of teachers.
The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 with little help of teachers.
The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 independently.
The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 independently and help others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20 with the help of the teacher.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20 with few mistakes.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20 correctly.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense upto 20 correctly, independently and helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers with extensive support.
The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers without support.
The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers independently.
The learner identifies and extends simple patterns in their surroundings, shapes and numbers independently and helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: Learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) in daily life situations.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner able to do addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) without/with regrouping and with support.
The learner able to do addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) without/with regrouping without support.
The learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) in daily life situations correctly.
The learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers upto 9 (sum not exceeding 20) in daily life situations independently with accuracy and helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner observes and describes physical properties of 3D shapes (solid shapes) around him/her like round/flat surfaces, number of corners and edges etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner observes and classifies 3-D shapes on the basis of physical properties around his/her environment with prompts and support.
The learner observes and classifies 3-D shapes on the basis of physical properties in his environment with little support.
The learner observes, classifies and describes physical properties of 3-D shapes in his/her environment correctly.
The learner observes, classifies and describes physical properties of 3-D shapes in his/her environment independently and helps others.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner estimates and verifies length using non- standard non- uniform units like hand span, footstep, fingers etc. and capacity using non- standard uniform units like cup, spoon, mug etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner compares and measures length/ capacity using non-standard non-uniform units with the help of teachers.
The learner compares and measures length/capacity using non-standard non-uniform units without the help of teachers.
The learner estimates and verifies length/capacity using non-standard non-uniform units with the help of teachers.
The learner estimates and verifies length / capacity using non-standard non-uniform units without the help of teacher and helps others too.

Entry Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 with the help of teachers.
The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 without help of teachers.
The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 independently.
The learner identifies Indian currency notes and coins upto INR 20 independently and help others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner counts objects and develops number sense up to 99.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner counts objects and develops number sense up to 99 with extensive support.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense up to 99. without some support.
The learner counts objects and develops number sense up to 99 without support.
The learner applies and estimates numerals up to 99 independently and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner creates new patterns from different shapes and numbers.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner creates new patterns from different shapes and numbers with extensive support.
The learner creates new patterns from different shapes and numbers without support.
The learner creates new patterns from different shapes and numbers independently.
The learner creates new patterns from different shapes and numbers independently and helps others.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses addition and subtraction of numbers up to 99, (sum not exceeding 99) in daily life situations.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner does addition and subtraction without/ with regrouping and with support.
The learner does addition and subtraction without/ with regrouping and without support.
The learner uses addition and subtraction in daily life situations with support.
The learner uses addition and subtraction in daily life situations independently with accuracy.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner performs multiplication as repeated addition and division as equal distribution/ sharing and constructs multiplication facts (tables) of 2, 3 and 4.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner performs multiplication (as repeated addition) and division (as equal sharing) with the support of the teacher.
The learner performs multiplication (as repeated addition) and division (as equal sharing) without the support of teacher
The learner performs & constructs multiplication facts and division with support.
The learner performs & constructs multiplication facts and division independently, correctly and helps others too.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner identifies and describes 2-D shapes like rectangle, triangle, circle, oval etc.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner identifies and describes 2-D shapes in his/her environment with the extensive help of teacher.
The learner identifies and describes 2-D shapes in his/her environment with some prompts.
The learner identifies and describes basic 2-D shapes in his/her environment independently.
The learner relates and describes basic 2-D shapes with 3-D shapes (solid shapes).

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner estimates and measures: length/distance / capacity using non standard uniform units like rod, pencil, thread, cup, spoon, mug etc. and compares weight using simple balance.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner compares and measures length/distance/capacity using non- standard uniform units with the help of teacher.
The learner compares and measures length/distance/capacity using non- standard uniform units without the help of teacher.
The learner estimates and relates length/distance/capacity using non-standard uniform units and compares weights using simple balance with the help of teacher.
The learner estimates and relates length/distance/capacity using non-standard uniform units and compares weights using simple balance without the help of teacher.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner uses spatial vocabulary like far/near, in/out, above /below, left/right, front/behind, top/ bottom etc. used in daily life.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner follows instructions involving spatial vocabulary like far/ near, in/ out, above/ below, front/ behind, left/right, top/bottom etc. with the help of teacher.
The learner follows instructions involving spatial vocabulary like far/ near, in/out, above/ below, front/ behind, left/right, top/ bottom etc. without the help of teacher.
The learner uses spatial vocabulary like far/ near, in/out, above/ below, front/ behind, left/right, top/ bottom etc. in their daily life.
The learner uses spatial vocabulary like far/ near, in/out, above/ below, front/ behind, left/right, top/ bottom etc. in their daily life and helps others to understand spatial vocabulary.

Exit Level.Learning_Outcome_English: The learner performs simple transactions using money upto INR 100.

Proficiency_Levels.Description_English: The learner performs simple transactions using money upto INR 100 with the help of teachers.
The learner performs simple transactions using money upto INR 100 without help of teachers.
The learner performs simple transactions using money upto INR 100 independently.
The learner performs simple transactions using money upto INR 100 independently and helps others.
